results.firPara: The bottles of water lined up on Pep Guardiolas table were branded City Football. There were so many people wanting entry they were giving out wristbands, festival-style, and when he took his seat there was a moment when he turned to his left, looked out of the window at the village-sized training ground and blew out his cheeks in admiration. A lot of people do that when they are new to this part of Manchester. It just resonates more when it is a member of football royalty, previously of Barcelona and Bayern Munich.
results.secPara: These were the moments when we were reminded how far this rejuvenated old club has come under the ownership of the Abu Dhabi royal family. Alan Ball used to turn up to some press conferences clutching a glass of beer. Frank Clark found out on his first day at City there was not enough training kit for the players and Kevin Keegans introductory press conference took place in a bar at Maine Road where what was left of the carpet stuck to ones shoes. Keegan, still raw from his experiences with England, had not received the memo that these events are supposed to be bright and convivial. The vultures are here, then? he had said before taking his seat.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola: ‘I need time. I know I don’t have time’ | Daniel Taylor

results.firPara: Thousands line streets of Cardiff to welcome players who came close to being the first British team to reach a major tournament final since 1966
results.secPara: When the great Welsh winger Cliff Jones got home after Wales reached the 1958 football world cup quarter-final, so the story goes, some of his friends asked him where he had been, so low-key was the event and the teams homecoming.
results.webTitle: Welsh dragons return home to triumphant scenes after Euro 2016

results.firPara: Victory over Portugal for Didier Deschamps mix of veteran and youthful talents would bring cheer to a country that has had a bloody and fretful year
results.secPara: Victory over Portugal for Didier Deschamps mix of veteran and youthful talents would bring cheer to a country that has had a bloody and fretful year
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: why France are favourites and would be popular champions

results.firPara: Bournemouth have signed the Leeds United midfielder Lewis Cook on a four-year contract, for an initial £6m fee.
results.secPara: The deal is expected to rise to nearer £10m with add-ons. Leeds rejected a bid from Bournemouth for the England Under-19s star in January. The 19-year-old had been a long-term target for Eddie Howe, who had personally scouted the Leeds youngster on several occasions last season.
results.webTitle: Bournemouth sign Lewis Cook from Leeds for fee rising to £10m

results.firPara: Leicester City have confirmed the signing of the Nigeria forward Ahmed Musa for an undisclosed fee, believed to be a club record £16m.
results.secPara: The Premier League champions have been seeking to strengthen their squad since the end of the season and had tried to sign Musa in January but saw a bid turned down by CSKA Moscow. But after finally making a breakthrough in negotiations, the 23-year-old is set to link up with Claudio Ranieris side before the new season.
results.webTitle: Leicester confirm signing of Ahmed Musa from CSKA Moscow

results.firPara: In todays Fiver the Euro 2016 final, Lazios free Saturday, and Jinkin Joe Ledley
results.secPara: In todays Fiver the Euro 2016 final, Lazios free Saturday, and Jinkin Joe Ledley
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Does a session with Dr Hubris await?

results.firPara: Rangers return to the Scottish Premiership could be hampered by the loss of two key players, after Martyn Waghorn and James Tavernier rejected new contracts from the Ibrox club.
results.secPara: English sides have now been alerted to the duos unhappiness over how negotiations have unfolded. Mark Warburton, the Rangers manager, is also still to sign a new deal, which has been under discussion since May.
results.webTitle: Martyn Waghorn and James Tavernier reject Rangers contract offers

results.firPara: Fans gathered at Cardiff Bale airport, while thousands more packing the streets of the capital for parade after Euro 2016 exploits
results.secPara: Fans gathered at Cardiff Bale airport, while thousands more packing the streets of the capital for parade after Euro 2016 exploits
results.webTitle: Wales football team touch down to heroes' welcome in Cardiff

results.firPara: They were still hollering La Marseillaise in the crammed streets around the Stade Vélodrome, the boulevards awash with tricolours and the mood celebratory, as Didier Deschamps ushered his victors through the massed ranks of media and out into the night. Those who had stopped to offer their thoughts had spoken of the excellence of Antoine Griezmann, of making history against the world champions and the need to focus on the challenge ahead. Portugal will be no pushovers. Yet the same theme kept cropping up a squad united; a team spirit that will not be shaken; a collective that, in Laurent Koscielnys words, remains unis, solide.
results.secPara: In some ways, it all felt distinctly un-French. For all that the chance to host these finals has conjured giddy memories of Michel Platini inspiring success back in 1984, or Zinedine Zidane and the spirit of black, blanc, beur (blacks, whites and Arabs) as the World Cup was claimed 14 years later, the national team have too often been associated with anarchy and infighting in recent times. It had blighted them in South Korea and Switzerland, and had even threatened to derail them here over Karim Benzema, Mathieu Valbuena and accusations of blackmail over a sex-tape, a scandal almost too outlandish to comprehend.
results.webTitle: Patrice Evra: how France have united behind unlikely father figure

results.firPara: Pep Guardiola has brushed off his rivalry with José Mourinho by claiming that Manchester Uniteds manager makes him a better coach.
results.secPara: Manchester Citys new head coach had a fractious relationship with the Portuguese when he was in charge of Barcelona and Mourinho led Real Madrid. Yet despite the two now working in the same city at clubs who are fierce enemies Guardiola is not concerned about Mourinhos presence.
results.webTitle: Manchester City’s Pep Guardiola relishing rivalry with José Mourinho
